TEXT.P: A "fishery" is a relatively isolated population of fish that is harvested for human use. For example, Atlantic cod in the Grand Banks off of Newfoundland represents an important North Atlantic fishery.
The growth of global fish capture in the 1900s was accomplished in part by the discovery of new, unexploited fisheries.
When a fishery is first discovered, it tends to produce low catches and is categorized as "undeveloped." The table at left show the percentage of undeveloped fisheries over the last 50 years.
